div.p: NC Governor Roy Cooper ordered all school buildings to remain closed through May 15, 2020. While this may not be the news we wanted to hear, we are excited to be continuing the excellent programs that we have put into place to feed our children and to teach our children through eLearning.

p.strong: In addition, we will continue to move forward with the following:

ul.li: Meal delivery to children began on March 17th, via yellow school buses following daily routes - on a 3-hour late start schedule. This allows families an estimate time to expect the buses at their normal bus stops.
Car-rider lines are open for drive through pick up from 11am–1pm.
This service is available Monday-Friday for children 18 and under. Children receive lunch along with a breakfast for the next morning. Meals are free of charge.
eLearning for students began on March 19th. Schools and teachers communicate with their families about the process for eLearning at their schools.
Contact the Technology Help Desk at 980-330-1078 for assistance.
Families are encouraged to stay in touch with their child’s teacher or to contact the school should they have questions.
District administrators continue to meet regularly to plan ahead as the news surrounding the coronavirus changes rapidly.
Professional Development online opportunities are available to all staff.
Regular communication to staff and parents is provided to keep all stakeholders informed.
